description: Manually curated historical executives discovered via web research
methodology: Web search + article verification for key clubs during coach youth/assistant periods (2010+)

executives.name: Johannes Spors

sources.title: HSV holt Scouting-Leiter Johannes Spors von RB Leipzig
HSV verpflichtet Johannes Spors als Scouting-Leiter

executives.notes: Key contact for coaches at RB Leipzig 2015-2018. Later became SD.

executives.name: Sebastian Kegel

sources.title: Sebastian Kegel übernimmt Leitung des Nachwuchsleistungszentrums

clubs.notes: U15 Trainer seit 2011, Director of NLZ from 2012

executives.notes: Critical contact for ALL youth coaches at RB Leipzig NLZ 2012-2023

executives.name: Wolfgang Dremmler

sources.title: Dremmler neuer Leiter des FCB-Nachwuchsbereichs

clubs.notes: 17 years as Chefscout/Abteilungsleiter Spiele-/Spielerbeobachtung

sources.title: Dremmler folgt auf Butt

clubs.notes: Transitioned from Scouting to Youth Leadership

executives.notes: Key figure for Bayern youth/scouting 1995-2017

executives.name: Hermann Gerland

sources.title: Hermann Gerland und Jochen Sauer übernehmen Leitung des NLZ

executives.notes: Led Bayern Campus youth development 2017-2024

executives.name: Jochen Sauer

sources.title: Hermann Gerland und Jochen Sauer übernehmen Leitung des NLZ

executives.notes: Bayern Campus director since 2017

executives.name: Sven Mislintat

sources.title: Sven Mislintat - Wikipedia

clubs.notes: Legendary BVB scout, signed Lewandowski, Aubameyang. Became Director of Professional Football 2017.

executives.notes: One of Germany's most successful scouts. Critical contact for BVB youth coaches 2009-2017.

executives.name: Lars Ricken

sources.title: Lars Ricken neuer Nachwuchskoordinator
Lars Ricken wird Direktor Nachwuchsleistungszentrum

executives.notes: BVB legend. Key figure for ALL youth coaches at Dortmund 2008-2024. Now Managing Director.

executives.name: Alexander Rosen

sources.title: Alexander Rosen im Interview
Alexander Rosen verlässt TSG Hoffenheim

clubs.notes: Built Hoffenheim's academy and scouting from 2010. Now at Gladbach.

executives.notes: Key architect of Hoffenheim's success. Critical for Hoffenheim youth coaches 2010-2023.

executives.name: Ralf Becker

sources.title: VfB Stuttgart trennt sich von Chefscout Becker

clubs.notes: Also headed youth department from 2012. Brought by Fredi Bobic.

executives.notes: Led scouting and youth operations 2011-2016. Key contact for youth coaches.

executives.name: Thomas Krücken

sources.title: Neuer Direktor NLZ

clubs.notes: Previously at Mainz 05. Left for Manchester City 2023.

executives.notes: Led VfB Stuttgart academy 2019-2023. Key for youth coach development.

executives.name: Fredi Bobic

sources.title: Die Sportdirektoren des VfB Stuttgart

clubs.notes: Europa League qualification 2012, DFB-Pokal final 2013.

executives.notes: Key decision maker at Stuttgart 2010-2014. Hired Ralf Becker.

executives.name: Jochen Saier

sources.title: Jochen Saier - Wikipedia

clubs.notes: Led youth academy directly managing youth coaches 2003-2013.

sources.title: SC Freiburg Board of Directors

clubs.notes: Transitioned to board-level oversight of youth development.

executives.notes: Primary contact for Freiburg youth coaches 2010-2024. Freiburg's youth architect.

executives.name: Klemens Hartenbach

sources.title: Klemens Hartenbach - Wikipedia

clubs.notes: Professionalized scouting from 2008.

sources.title: Klemens Hartenbach Transfermarkt

clubs.notes: Known as Freiburg's 'eye' for talent.

executives.notes: Led scouting 2006-2013, SD since 2014. Key contact for technical staff.

executives.name: Volker Kersting

sources.title: Mainz 05 Academy page

clubs.notes: Manages 200+ youth players across 11+ teams.

executives.notes: Academy director since at least 2015. Key contact for all Mainz youth coaches.

executives.name: André Hechelmann

sources.title: Schalke holt Mainzer Chefscout André Hechelmann

clubs.notes: Started admin 2011, progressed to U23 manager and scouting. Later Bayern scout.

executives.notes: Long-tenured Mainz staff member 2011-2019. Now at Bayern.

executives.name: Siegfried Marti

sources.title: Siggi Marti profile on RocketReach

clubs.notes: Previously at Werder Bremen as Chefscout. Left Mainz for KAS Eupen.

executives.notes: Led Mainz scouting 2016-2019.

executives.name: Max Eberl

sources.title: Max Eberl steps down as Borussia Mönchengladbach sporting director

clubs.notes: Promoted to management board June 2010. Resigned January 28, 2022 due to burnout. Oversaw Champions League qualification 4 times.

executives.notes: One of the most successful sporting directors in Gladbach history. Key figure in developing youth coaches and establishing modern scouting infrastructure.

executives.name: Roland Virkus

sources.title: Mirko Sandmöller ist neuer Direktor des Nachwuchs-Leistungszentrums

clubs.notes: At the club since 1990 in various youth coaching roles. Became NLZ Director in 2008. Promoted to Sportdirektor in February 2022.

sources.title: Roland Virkus resigns as Borussia Mönchengladbach sporting director

clubs.notes: Promoted from Academy Director to replace Max Eberl. Resigned September 30, 2025.

executives.notes: Long-serving Gladbach figure who transitioned from youth development to sporting director. Critical link between academy operations and first team during 2010-2024 period.

executives.name: Mirko Sandmöller

sources.title: Mirko Sandmöller ist neuer Direktor des Nachwuchs-Leistungszentrums

clubs.notes: At the club since 2008 in various roles. Appointed March 2, 2022 to succeed Roland Virkus. Still in position as of 2026.

executives.notes: Works closely with youth coaches and assistant coaches developing through the academy system. Key figure for understanding coaching pathways at Gladbach post-2022.

executives.name: Steffen Korell

sources.title: Korell gibt Gladbach-Scouting ab - Hechelmann kommt von Bayern

clubs.notes: Former player at the club. Became Chefscout in 2017. Stepped down from scouting role in February 2026 to become management consultant/advisor. Over 8 years tenure in scouting leadership.

executives.notes: Long-serving club figure with deep institutional knowledge. Would have worked with many youth and assistant coaches during his scouting tenure 2017-2026.

executives.name: Pierre Littbarski

sources.title: VfL Wolfsburg: Littbarski verlängert & wird Chefscout

clubs.notes: Former World Champion appointed as head scout by Felix Magath in January 2012. Contract as Chefscout expired in summer 2018, transitioned to marketing/PR role.

executives.notes: Key contact for scouting department 2012-2018 during period when many youth coaches were developing.

executives.name: Fabian Wohlgemuth

sources.title: Fabian Wohlgemuth – Wikipedia

clubs.notes: Joined VfL Wolfsburg in 2011 as Chief Scout at the Nachwuchsleistungszentrum. Appointed Director of NLZ six months later. Left in June 2018 to become CEO for Sports at Holstein Kiel. Spent seven years managing the VfL academy.

executives.notes: Critical contact for ALL youth coaches at Wolfsburg 2011-2018. Later worked at Holstein Kiel, SC Paderborn, and now VfB Stuttgart.

executives.name: Pablo Thiam

sources.title: Neustrukturierung in der Akademie

clubs.notes: Took over full responsibility as head of VfL academy in July 2018, succeeding Fabian Wohlgemuth. Previously served as sporting director of U23 team from 2009. Left in July 2021 to become head of sport for Hertha BSC academy.

executives.notes: Key contact for youth coaches 2018-2021. Three-year tenure bridging Wohlgemuth and Gentner eras.

executives.name: Michael Gentner

sources.title: Neuer Akademie-Direktor

clubs.notes: Became Academy Director on February 1, 2022, succeeding Pablo Thiam. Previously spent 18 years at VfB Stuttgart. Signed contract extension through 2030 in 2024. Current academy director.

executives.notes: Current academy director since February 2022. Key contact for all current youth coaching staff.

executives.name: Jörg Schmadtke

sources.title: Jörg Schmadtke - Wikipedia

clubs.notes: Five-year tenure as top sports executive. Contract ended January 31, 2023. Later joined Liverpool as sporting director.

executives.notes: Key decision-maker 2018-2023 for all sporting matters including youth development and scouting. Father of Nils Schmadtke.

executives.name: Sebastian Schindzielorz

sources.title: Hundertprozentige Identifikation

clubs.notes: Former VfL player (2008-2013), part of 2009 championship team. Appointed Sportdirektor in February 2023. Relieved of duties November 13, 2025.

executives.notes: Recent Sportdirektor 2023-2025, worked alongside Marcel Schäfer and later successors.

executives.name: Tim Steidten

sources.title: Tim Steidten brought stars to Werder Bremen and Leverkusen

clubs.notes: Advanced to chief youth scout in 2010, oversaw scouting network for club's youth teams

sources.title: Tim Steidten - Wikipedia

clubs.notes: Progressed from youth scout to chief scout for senior team. Combined tenure as chief scout: 5 years (2010-2015). Later became Sporting Director (2015-2019).

executives.notes: Key figure in Werder's scouting structure 2010-2019. Signed players like Serge Gnabry, Thomas Delaney, Davy Klaassen. Emphasized data-led approach.

executives.name: Clemens Fritz

sources.title: Clemens Fritz wird Leiter Scouting bei Werder Bremen

clubs.notes: Appointed November 2019, succeeding Tim Steidten. Former Werder player (2006-2017)

clubs.role: Head of Scouting and Professional Football

sources.title: Clemens Fritz takes over a newly-created role

clubs.notes: Expanded role in August 2020. Total tenure in scouting leadership: ~5 years (Nov 2019 - June 2024). Promoted to Managing Director for Sport in July 2024.

executives.notes: Former player at Werder (2006-2017), made 363 competitive appearances. Became Managing Director for Sport in summer 2024.

executives.name: Björn Schierenbeck

sources.title: Björn Schierenbeck: Die Gesamtkonstellation ist nahezu perfekt

clubs.notes: Initially took over position on interim basis in May 2013. Officially confirmed as director August 2013. Led NLZ for 11 years until October 2024. Former Werder player. Moved to Top-Talent Coordinator role in October 2024.

executives.notes: Long-serving academy director (11 years). Responsible for overseeing academy development and women's football.

executives.name: Thomas Wolter

sources.title: Thomas Wolter - Wikipedia

clubs.notes: Appointed July 2013 as Sporting Director responsible for all youth teams (U19-U23). Previously coached Werder II (2002-2013). Former professional player and two-time German champion. Tenure: 11+ years (2013-present)

executives.notes: Long-serving academy sporting director since 2013. Works alongside Marc Dommer. Former Werder player and coach of U23 team for 11 years before promotion.

executives.name: Thomas Schaaf

sources.title: Thomas Schaaf becomes technical director at SV Werder

clubs.notes: Contract from July 1, 2018 to end of July 2021. Responsible for uniform training structure and footballing philosophy across academy. Headed chain of command in academy and worked as mentor for coaches. Former head coach 1999-2013. Contract not renewed due to economic situation after relegation.

executives.notes: Legendary figure at Werder Bremen. Head coach 1999-2013 (won double in 2004). Returned as Technical Director 2018-2021. Position not filled after his departure due to cost reductions.

executives.name: Bruno Hübner

sources.title: Nach zehn Jahren: Bruno Hübner verlässt Eintracht Frankfurt
Bruno Hübner - Eintracht Frankfurt Männer

clubs.notes: Served 10 years as Sporting Director. Oversaw promotion to Bundesliga in 2012, DFB-Pokal win in 2018, and 3 Europa League qualifications. Left at contract expiry June 30, 2021.

executives.notes: Key decision-maker who would have worked with coaches during Frankfurt's resurgence from 2011-2021.

executives.name: Fredi Bobic

sources.title: Fredi Bobic - Wikipedia
Wie Fredi Bobic Frankfurt zu einem Topclub gemacht hat

clubs.notes: Board member for sports. Served 1819 days. DFB-Pokal winner 2018. Left for Hertha BSC July 1, 2021.

executives.notes: Top-level executive who worked closely with head coaches and would have interacted with assistant coaches.

executives.name: Markus Krösche

sources.title: Markus Krösche - Wikipedia
Markus Krösche - Eintracht Frankfurt Klub

clubs.notes: Became Sporting Director in April 2021 as successor to Fredi Bobic. Previously at RB Leipzig.

executives.notes: Current top decision-maker for sports/coaching matters at Frankfurt.

executives.name: Timmo Hardung

sources.title: Eintracht Frankfurt makes two new appointments

clubs.notes: Came from RB Leipzig. Promoted to Sporting Director July 1, 2023.

sources.title: Timmo Hardung wird zur neuen Saison Sportdirektor
Timmo Hardung - Manager profile | Transfermarkt

clubs.notes: Promoted from Head of First Team Football to Sporting Director. Contract extended until 2028.

executives.notes: Current Sporting Director, key decision-maker for coaching appointments and squad planning.

executives.name: Bernd Hölzenbein

sources.title: Eintracht Frankfurt erweitert seine Scouting-Abteilung
Zum 75. Geburtstag von Bernd Hölzenbein

clubs.notes: Club legend. Served as Chief Scout 2004-2014 (covers 2010-2014 target period). After 2014, remained as advisor and co-leader of scouting department with Legien. Passed away April 15, 2024.

executives.notes: Club legend with 10 years as Chief Scout who would have known all coaches and scouts during 2010-2014 period.

executives.name: Bernd Legien

sources.title: Eintracht Frankfurt verpflichtet neuen Chef-Scout Bernd Legien
Bernd Legien macht Platz für Ben Manga
Scouting ist keine Zauberei - Bernd Legien reformiert die Spielersichtung

clubs.notes: Hired from FC Ingolstadt to restructure scouting system. Contract through summer 2017 but replaced by Ben Manga in 2016. Only ~2 years tenure.

executives.notes: Short tenure (2 years) but reformed Frankfurt's scouting structure during critical period.

executives.name: Ben Manga

sources.title: Ben Manga - Wikipedia
Ben Manga im Porträt - kicker-Serie, Teil 4: Eintracht Frankfurt

clubs.notes: Initial role as Chief Scout under Fredi Bobic 2016-2021, responsible for building scouting department.

sources.title: Eintracht Frankfurt und Ben Manga gehen getrennte Wege

clubs.notes: Promoted to Director of Professional Football in 2021 after Bobic/Hübner departures. Departed by mutual consent November 30, 2022. Joined Watford FC as Technical Director December 2022.

executives.notes: Key figure in Frankfurt's successful transfer policy 2016-2022. Worked closely with coaching staff on squad planning.

executives.name: Sebastian Frank

sources.title: Sebastian Frank - LinkedIn
Sebastian Frank - Manager profile | Transfermarkt

clubs.notes: Current Head of Scouting since July 2021. Previously worked at Borussia Dortmund, Liverpool FC (with Jürgen Klopp), and Leicester City. Son of Wolfgang Frank.

executives.notes: Current scouting chief with extensive experience at top European clubs.

executives.name: Armin Kraaz

sources.title: Armin Kraaz - Wikipedia
Armin Kraaz übernimmt Aufbau internationaler Projekte
30-jähriges Dienstjubiläum für Armin Kraaz

clubs.notes: Academy Director from January 1, 2010 to September 30, 2019. Nearly 10 years leading youth development. Previously Sporting Director 2003-2009. Now Vice President Sport (since July 2024).

executives.notes: Club legend and former player. Key figure who would have worked with all youth coaches 2010-2019. Over 30 years with the club in various roles.

executives.name: Andreas Möller

sources.title: Andreas Möller ist neuer Leiter des NLZ
Vorzeitiger Führungswechsel im NLZ

clubs.notes: Academy Director October 2019 - March 31, 2022. Contract until June 2022 but resigned early for personal reasons in February 2022. World Cup winner, European champion, Champions League winner.

executives.notes: Only ~2.5 years tenure but brings significant coaching network from illustrious playing career.

executives.name: Alexander Richter

sources.title: Alexander Richter wird NLZ-Leiter bei Eintracht Frankfurt
Richter wird neuer NLZ-Leiter
Eintracht Frankfurt verlängert Vertrag mit NLZ-Leiter Alexander Richter

clubs.notes: Current Academy Director since April 1, 2022. Came from VfL Bochum where he was in same role for 14 years. Contract extended through 2024+.

executives.notes: Current academy leader with extensive experience from VfL Bochum. Key contact for youth/assistant coach networks.

executives.name: Rudi Völler

sources.title: Bayer Leverkusen: Rudi Völler und Fernando Carro neue Geschäftsführer
Rudi Völler: The man that did it all and revolutionised Bayer Leverkusen

clubs.notes: Returned to Leverkusen as Sportdirektor in 2005 after coaching AS Roma. Served in this role for 13+ years, building foundation for modern era. Contract extended until June 30, 2022 in 2016.

sources.title: Bayer Leverkusen baut personell um: Rudi Völler nun Geschäftsführer, Boldt Sportdirektor
Rolfes named sporting managing director – Völler is member of shareholder committee and club ambassador

clubs.notes: Promoted to newly created position of Geschäftsführer Sport on July 1, 2018. Received official farewell at final game of 2021/22 season vs SC Freiburg at BayArena in May 2022. Remained with club as member of shareholder committee and official ambassador from July 1, 2022.

executives.notes: Club legend who revolutionized Bayer Leverkusen's sporting operations 2005-2022. Key figure in establishing modern scouting infrastructure and youth development philosophy. Mentored Jonas Boldt and Simon Rolfes into leadership roles. Oversaw Champions League qualification multiple times during tenure.

executives.name: Jonas Boldt

sources.title: Leverkusens Scouting-Leiter Jonas Boldt im Interview
Who is Jonas Boldt?

clubs.notes: Took over as Chefscout in 2009, became assistant to sporting director Rudi Völler. Discovered key players including Arturo Vidal, Dani Carvajal, and Toni Kroos. Built data-informed scouting structure with strong reach across Europe and South America.

sources.title: Who is Jonas Boldt?
Jonas Boldt - Wikipedia

clubs.notes: Promoted to Sportmanager for 2014/15 season under Völler after Michael Reschke left for Bayern Munich. Continued building recruitment capabilities while broadening role to squad management.

sources.title: Simon Rolfes new sporting director – Jonas Boldt leaves Bayer 04 in the summer
HSV present new head of sport Jonas Boldt

clubs.notes: Moved to lead Sports Direction effective July 1, 2018 (position previously held by Völler). From December 1, 2018, handed position to Simon Rolfes and served as advisor until May 2019. Left for Hamburg SV in summer 2019.

executives.notes: Long-serving Leverkusen executive (2007-2019) who progressed from scout to sporting director. Critical figure in establishing modern recruitment and development infrastructure 2009-2019. Worked with numerous youth and assistant coaches during scouting and management tenure. Helped qualify team for European competitions consistently.

executives.name: Simon Rolfes

sources.title: Simon Rolfes new sporting director – Jonas Boldt leaves Bayer 04 in the summer
Simon Rolfes: Who is Bayer Leverkusen's behind-the-scenes mastermind?

clubs.notes: Took over from Jonas Boldt with effect from December 1, 2018. Contract initially to June 30, 2024. Prior to this, served as head of youth and development for five months. Former player (2005-2015, 377 appearances).

sources.title: Rolfes named sporting managing director – Völler is member of shareholder committee and club ambassador
Bayer 04 seal long-term deal with Simon Rolfes

clubs.notes: Succeeded Rudi Völler as Managing Director Sports on July 1, 2022. Key architect of unbeaten 2023/24 Bundesliga championship season. Recruited Florian Wirtz, Alejandro Grimaldo, and Xabi Alonso among others. Sealed long-term contract extension.

executives.notes: Former Leverkusen midfielder (2005-2015, 26 Germany caps) who transitioned into management. Demonstrated exceptional talent identification and recruitment strategy. Works closely with youth development and coaching staff. Mastermind behind Leverkusen's modern revival and 2023/24 double-winning season.

executives.name: Tim Steidten

sources.title: Bayer 04 sign squad planner Tim Steidten
Bayer Leverkusen part ways with squad manager Tim Steidten

clubs.notes: Joined from Werder Bremen in July 2019 as head of scouting. Later also served as sports coordinator. Working under Simon Rolfes, secured young talents including Edmond Tapsoba, Jeremie Frimpong, and Piero Hincapie. Left March 2023, later joined West Ham United as Technical Director.

executives.notes: Head of scouting during critical transition period 2019-2023. Previously Head of Youth Scouting at Werder Bremen 2010-2012. Contributed to squad building that led to eventual Bundesliga title. Under 2 years minimum but meets 2+ years tenure requirement (3.75 years).

executives.name: Kim Falkenberg

sources.title: Kim Falkenberg – once Leverkusen, always Leverkusen
Bundesliga: Das sind die Scouting-Abteilungen der 18 Klubs

clubs.notes: Started working with scouting department in 2018 immediately after ending playing career at VfL Osnabrück. At age 31, became head scout for the Werkself in 2019. Former Leverkusen youth player and professional.

clubs.role: Leiter Scouting und Kaderplanung / Head of Recruitment

sources.title: Tactics Corner - Bayer Leverkusen 2.0: Squad planning, 2024 tactics and unsung heroes
Bayer 04 appoint Kim Falkenberg as Director of Football

clubs.notes: Promoted to head of recruitment in 2023. In cooperation with Xabi Alonso and Simon Rolfes, contributed significantly to squad building for 2023/24 championship season. Close cooperation with Rolfes based on mutual trust.

sources.title: Bayer 04 appoint Kim Falkenberg as Director of Football
Bayer Leverkusen befördert Kim Falkenberg vom Kaderplaner zum Director Football

clubs.notes: Appointed Director of Football with effect from March 1, 2025. At the club since 2018, progression from youth section to head scout (2019) to head of recruitment (2023) to Director of Football. Represents new generation of club leadership.

executives.notes: Former Leverkusen youth product who returned post-playing career. Rapid progression through scouting ranks 2018-2025. Key figure in modern recruitment strategy and squad planning. Works closely with youth coaches and development staff. Critical to understanding coaching pathways at Leverkusen post-2018.

executives.name: Thomas Eichin

sources.title: Thomas Eichin appointed academy head at Bayer 04
Thomas Eichin appointed Director Licensing at Bayer 04

clubs.notes: Took over as head of youth academy (Leiter Nachwuchs) on July 1, 2020, responsible for Nachwuchsleistungszentrum with all youth teams. Promoted to Director Licensing (newly created position) on July 1, 2023, responsible for internal processes in professional sections for men's and women's teams. Continued reporting to Simon Rolfes in new role.

executives.notes: Academy director during 3-year period when several youth talents emerged into first team consideration. Transition to Director Licensing represented promotion and organizational restructuring. Works with youth coaches and development pathways.

executives.name: Jefta Bresser

sources.title: Bayer 04 appoint Jefta Bresser as new academy head
Inside Bayer Leverkusen's academy: Bundesliga champions want to sustain their success and know youth is key

clubs.notes: Trained academy director and football coach, age 52. Took over as head of Leverkusen's performance centre in October 2023. Previously enjoyed 5 years of success as head of youth academy at De Graafschap (2018-2023). Between 2005-2015, responsible for individual development of youth players at PSV Eindhoven, FC Fulham, and Zenit St. Petersburg. Implementing reforms to youth development system including player selection processes and coaching development initiatives. Still in position as of 2026.

executives.notes: Current academy director tasked with delivering changes demanded by leadership. Brought extensive international experience in youth development. Works closely with coaching staff across all youth age groups. Key figure for understanding modern coaching pathways and youth development at Leverkusen post-2023. Does not yet meet 2+ year minimum but included as current officeholder.

executives.name: Manfred Pomp

sources.title: Manfred Pomp - Head of NLZ-Scouting/Nachwuchs-Chefscout - Bayer 04 Leverkusen
Manfred Pomp Email & Phone Number - Bayer 04 Leverkusen Head of NLZ-Scouting

clubs.notes: Head of NLZ-Scouting and youth chief scout based in Aachen, NRW. Responsible for leading and developing NLZ-Scouting, overseeing all processes and quality management. Certified football teacher from Deutsche Sporthochschule Köln. Previous experience at Fussballverband Mittelrhein (FVM). Estimated start date ~2010 based on career timeline, exact start date not confirmed in available sources. Long-tenured figure in youth scouting operations.

executives.notes: Specialized role focused exclusively on youth academy scouting rather than first-team scouting. Works closely with academy directors and youth coaching staff. Important figure for understanding youth talent identification and recruitment pathways throughout 2010-2024 period. Confidence level medium due to lack of official club announcements confirming exact dates, but multiple professional sources confirm long-term tenure in role.

executives.name: Theo Grieß (Gries)

sources.title: Theo Gries neuer Leiter des Nachwuchsleistungszentrums
Die Scouting-Abteilung des 1. FC Union Berlin

clubs.notes: Served as youth director from April 1, 2008. Transitioned to scouting department in 2011 after Hermann Andreev took over NLZ leadership. Previously scored 130 goals in 300 games as a player.

executives.notes: Experienced academy director who transitioned to scouting. Long tenure provides deep knowledge of youth development and player pathways.

executives.name: Hermann Andreev

sources.title: 1. FC Union Berlin verpflichtet Hermann Andreev als sportlichen Leiter des Nachwuchsleistungszentrums
NLZ: Veränderung auf der Leitungsebene

clubs.notes: Appointed August 17, 2010 as sporting director of NLZ alongside Lutz Munack (technical director). Stepped down from dual role as U17 trainer and NLZ sporting director in October 2017, choosing to focus solely on coaching. During his tenure, the NLZ achieved three-star certification (highest rating) in 2016.

executives.notes: Led Union Berlin's NLZ through critical growth period including promotion to Bundesliga. Previously coached VFC Plauen to Regionalliga (2008) and SV Babelsberg to 2. Bundesliga (2001). Over 7 years as academy director.

executives.name: Janek Kampa

sources.title: NLZ: Veränderung auf der Leitungsebene
Zertifizierung mit drei Sternen: Nachwuchsleistungszentrum des 1. FC Union Berlin erhält erstmals höchste Bewertung
The Youth Academy - Union Berlin

clubs.notes: Served as Organisatorischer Leiter (Organizational Director) from at least 2016. Assumed full sporting leadership of NLZ in October 2017 when Hermann Andreev stepped down. Currently listed as Head of Youth Academy. Oversaw NLZ's continued three-star certification and development during Union's rise to Bundesliga and European competition.

executives.notes: Long-serving academy director who has overseen Union's youth development during the club's most successful period. Works closely with André Hofschneider (Head of Coaching) to manage transitions from youth to first team.

executives.name: Oliver Ruhnert

sources.title: Oliver Ruhnert wird Geschäftsführer Profifußball
Union startet mit Horst Heldt und Oliver Ruhnert

clubs.notes: Joined as Chefscout in summer 2017. Promoted to Geschäftsführer Profifußball on May 15, 2018, but continued to oversee scouting operations. Returned to Chefscout role July 1, 2024 after six years as managing director. Left Union Berlin entirely in November 2025.

executives.notes: Architect of Union Berlin's rise from 2. Bundesliga to Champions League. Previously spent 10 years at Schalke 04 in academy roles. Known for data-driven scouting and squad building on limited budgets. Key figure in identifying and developing talent during Union's most successful era (2019-2024).

executives.name: Michael Parensen

sources.title: Michael Parensen wird Technischer Direktor
Union und Michael Parensen beenden ihre Zusammenarbeit

clubs.notes: Former Union Berlin player (249 games) who transitioned to front office after career ended in 2020. Completed DFB management course and served as assistant to Oliver Ruhnert before promotion to Technical Director in summer 2022. Departed April 7, 2024 after 15 total years with the club. Later sued Union Berlin over his dismissal.

executives.notes: Club legend who made successful transition from player to executive. Responsible for technical and administrative operations during Union's Champions League campaign (2023-24). Departure was controversial.

executives.name: Stefan Studer

sources.title: Ex-Profi Stefan Studer kehrt als Chefscout zum FC St. Pauli zurück

clubs.notes: First tenure as Chefscout from 2009-2012, responsible for professional team and youth academy scouting

sources.title: Ex-Profi Stefan Studer kehrt als Chefscout zum FC St. Pauli zurück
Neue Struktur im Scoutingbereich des FC St. Pauli

clubs.notes: Second tenure as Chefscout, contract started November 1, 2015 and ended October 31, 2018. Responsible for professional team and youth academy scouting.

executives.notes: Former FC St. Pauli player who returned to the club in scouting capacity. Total of 6+ years in scouting role across two tenures during the target period.

executives.name: Tobias Hentschel

sources.title: Neue Struktur im Scoutingbereich des FC St. Pauli

clubs.notes: Took over overall responsibility for both squad planning and scouting after Stefan Studer's departure. Previously responsible for squad planning before this combined role.

executives.notes: Bridged the gap between Stefan Studer and Jan Sandmann in the scouting department. Combined squad planning with scouting responsibilities.

executives.name: Jan Sandmann

clubs.role: Leiter des Scoutings sowie der Kaderplanung / Chefscout

sources.title: Der FC St. Pauli verlängert mit Jan Sandmann
Jan Sandmann - Manager profile | Transfermarkt
Weitere Weichenstellung im Hintergrund

clubs.notes: Appointed March 16, 2020 as Head of Scouting and Squad Planning. Previously scout at 1. FC Nürnberg and assistant coach at Holstein Kiel. Contract extended beyond 2023/24 season in April 2024.

executives.current_role: Leiter des Scoutings sowie der Kaderplanung
executives.notes: Key figure in FC St. Pauli's current scouting and transfer strategy. Described by Andreas Bornemann as one of his most important colleagues with strong ability to identify players with development potential.

executives.name: Roger Stilz

sources.title: Roger Stilz neuer Sportlicher Leiter des NLZ
NLZ-Leiter Roger Stilz verlässt den FC St. Pauli

clubs.notes: NLZ-Leiter from June 2016 to early January 2021 (4.5+ years). Modernized academy across sports psychology, athletic training, video analysis, and goalkeeper instruction. Left to become sporting director at Waasland-Beveren (Belgium).

executives.notes: Significantly developed FC St. Pauli's youth academy infrastructure and improved pathways from academy to professional squad during his tenure.

executives.name: Benjamin Liedtke

sources.title: NLZ-Leiter Roger Stilz verlässt den FC St. Pauli
Benjamin Liedtke - Manager profile | Transfermarkt
FC St. Pauli befördert Liedtke: Leiter des Nachwuchszentrums

clubs.notes: Initially took over NLZ leadership on interim basis in January 2021 when Roger Stilz left, then made permanent on January 15, 2021. Has worked at FC St. Pauli NLZ for 14+ years, starting as trainer. Since 2022, shares leadership with Fabian Seeger.

executives.notes: Long-time FC St. Pauli academy employee with deep institutional knowledge. Leads innovative 'Rebellution' youth development approach since 2024.

executives.name: Fabian Seeger

sources.title: Fabian Seeger wird Sportlicher Leiter des NLZ
Fabian Seeger - Manager profile | Transfermarkt

clubs.notes: Appointed January 1, 2022 as Sportlicher Leiter (Sports Director) of NLZ, forming dual leadership with Benjamin Liedtke. Previously DFB support point coordinator for 10 years and sports director at Altona 93 (2012-2017).

executives.notes: Responsible for sporting direction of NLZ in close consultation with coaches. Holds Trainer A-License and brings extensive talent development experience.

executives.name: Ewald Lienen

sources.title: Nach über sieben Jahren am Millerntor: Der FC St. Pauli verabschiedet Ewald Lienen
Ewald Lienen - Manager profile | Transfermarkt
FC St. Pauli: Ewald Lienen hört als Trainer auf und wird Technischer Direktor

clubs.notes: Technischer Direktor from July 1, 2017 to December 31, 2020 (3.5 years). Responsible for training development and coach development in the youth performance center. Previously served as FC St. Pauli head coach (December 2014 - June 2017). After Technical Director role, served as club representative/values ambassador (January 2021 - June 2022).

executives.notes: Total of 7.5+ years at FC St. Pauli in various capacities. As Technical Director, focused on coach development and served as advisor to decision-making bodies, management, and coaches.

executives.name: Frank Schaefer

sources.title: Frank Schaefer verlässt den FC
NLZ entzweit Schaefer und Köln

clubs.notes: Led NLZ from July 1, 2013 to March 31, 2016. Tenure: 2 years, 9 months. Previously worked in youth roles at FC since 2003.

executives.notes: Experienced academy director who certified the Köln youth academy and worked with coaches developing into professional roles.

executives.name: Daniel Meyer

sources.title: Neue Wege: FC rüstet im Nachwuchsbereich auf
Cheftrainer in Aue: Daniel Meyer verlässt den 1. FC Köln

clubs.notes: Led NLZ (Sport) from July 1, 2016 to June 25, 2018 in dual leadership with Carsten Schiel. Tenure: 2 years. Responsible for sporting aspects. Left to become head coach at Erzgebirge Aue.

executives.notes: Part of dual leadership structure. Worked with youth coaches before moving to senior coaching role.

executives.name: Carsten Schiel

sources.title: Schaefer-Nachfolge geregelt: Doppel-Spitze beim NLZ
Berg in Doppelfunktion: 1. FC Köln strukturiert NLZ neu

clubs.notes: Led NLZ (Development) from July 1, 2016 to November 2022. Tenure: 6+ years. Responsible for pedagogical, psychological, and social aspects. Continued in dual leadership with Heidrich 2018-2022. Transitioned to Coordinator for Pedagogy & Psychology.

executives.notes: Long-serving academy executive focused on holistic player development. Worked with multiple academy directors and youth coaches.

executives.name: Matthias Heidrich

sources.title: 1. FC Köln: Matthias Heidrich ist neuer Nachwuchs-Chef
1. FC Köln: Heidrich wechselt vom NLZ nach Aue

clubs.notes: Led NLZ (Sport) from September 15, 2018 to September 28, 2022. Tenure: 4 years. Worked in dual leadership with Carsten Schiel. Left to become Sports Director at Erzgebirge Aue. Previously NLZ director at Energie Cottbus.

executives.notes: Experienced academy director who oversaw development of talents like Florian Wirtz. Connected to extensive network of youth coaches.

executives.name: Lukas Berg

sources.title: Lukas Berg ist neuer Leiter des Nachwuchsleistungszentrums
Lukas Berg wird Technischer Direktor beim 1. FC Köln

clubs.notes: Led NLZ from November 2022 (combined role as head of academy and managing director of boarding school). Tenure: 2.5+ years within 2010-2024 period. Promoted to Technical Director in 2025. With FC since 2016.

sources.title: Lukas Berg wird Technischer Direktor beim 1. FC Köln

clubs.notes: Newly created position. Forms leadership duo with Sports Director Thomas Kessler. Contract until 2028. Falls outside 2010-2024 target period.

executives.notes: Rising executive who worked his way up through FC system. Academy success included U19 DFB-Pokal 2023 and Championship. Now in senior leadership role.

executives.name: Jörg Jakobs

sources.title: Dr. Jörg Jakobs - Manager profile
1. FC Köln: Jörg Jakobs bleibt und wird befördert

clubs.notes: Started 2012/13 season as head of squad planning and chief scout. Tenure: ~2 years before promotion to sporting director. Also took over academy director responsibilities in 2014.

executives.notes: Key figure in FC restructuring 2012-2017. Promoted to Sporting Director in 2014 with expanded responsibilities including academy oversight.

executives.name: Manfred Schmid

sources.title: 1. FC Köln: Manfred Schmid kehrt als Chefscout zurück
Schmid nicht mehr Co-Trainer: Lösung beim Abendessen?

clubs.notes: Announced February 20, 2019. Transitioned to co-trainer April 27, 2019. Tenure as Chefscout: ~2-3 months. Does NOT meet 2+ year minimum tenure requirement. Previously co-trainer 2013-2017.

executives.notes: Brief tenure as chief scout. Primarily known for coaching roles. Does not meet minimum tenure criteria.

executives.name: Willi Kronhardt

sources.title: 1. FC Köln: Willi Kronhardt ist neuer Chefscout
Heldt bestätigt: Nach Aehlig geht auch Chefscout Kronhardt

clubs.notes: Appointed May 30, 2019 with 2-year contract. Left June 30, 2021. Tenure: 2 years exactly. Meets minimum tenure requirement. Succeeded Manfred Schmid.

executives.notes: Experienced scout who met tenure requirements. Later moved to RB Leipzig scouting department.

executives.name: Martin Schulz

sources.title: Schulz wird Chefscout: Cerny kommt zusätzlich zum FC
Differenzen mit Keller: 1. FC Köln schmeißt Chefscout raus

clubs.notes: Promoted December 2020 as successor to Kronhardt. Left April 2025. Tenure: ~4.5 years total, with 3+ years in 2010-2024 period. With FC since 2013 in various scouting roles. Replaced by Gabor Ruhr.

executives.notes: Nearly 12 years with FC in total, 4.5 as Chefscout. Worked through multiple sporting directors. Extensive network from long tenure.

executives.name: Stephan Schwarz

sources.title: Schwarz wird Technischer Direktor in Augsburg
Stephan Schwarz im AJ-Interview

clubs.notes: Served as Chief Scout from 2013-2016, then promoted to Technical Director. Helped shape club's most successful period including UEFA Europa League qualification.

sources.title: Schwarz wird Technischer Direktor in Augsburg
FC Augsburg part ways with Manuel Baum, Jens Lehmann and Stephan Schwarz

clubs.notes: Extended contract until 2020 when promoted to Technical Director in 2016. Left club on April 9, 2019. Was over 6 years at club total.

executives.notes: Key figure during Augsburg's most successful period, co-responsible for sporting direction. Left in 2019 and later joined GC Zürich.

executives.name: Timon Pauls

sources.title: Timon Pauls wird Chefscout und Kaderplaner beim FCA
FC Augsburg angelt sich Chefscout Timon Pauls vom FC Bayern

clubs.notes: Joined from FC Bayern Munich where he was youth academy chief scout (2015-2020). Started May 1, 2020. Later moved to Hertha BSC.

executives.notes: Previously worked at Bayern Munich youth academy for 10 years. Holds relevant scouting qualifications and experience.

executives.name: Babacar Wane

sources.title: FCA treibt Strukturentwicklung im Sport voran
FC Augsburg: Janker steigt auf, Wane neuer Chefscout
FCA entspricht Wunsch von Babacar Wane

clubs.notes: 59-year-old with previous experience at Hertha BSC, Eintracht Frankfurt, and SC Freiburg. France expert who helped sign players like Alexis Claude-Maurice and Chrislain Matsima. Left on own request in July 2025 to join VfL Bochum. Tenure too short for minimum criteria.

executives.notes: Brief tenure at Augsburg (March 2024 - July 2025), does not meet 2+ year minimum. Included for completeness.

executives.name: Claus Schromm

clubs.role: Cheftrainer Nachwuchs, Bereichsleiter U23 und U19

sources.title: Schromm: 'Der Mensch steht bei mir über allem'
Claus Schromm - Cheftrainer Nachwuchs, Bereichsleiter U23 und U19

clubs.notes: Head Youth Coach and department leader for U23/U19. Started August 12, 2021. UEFA Pro License holder. First season teams won 4 championships including U19 league title. Previously at SpVgg Unterhaching and TSV 1860 Munich.

executives.current_role: Cheftrainer Nachwuchs, Bereichsleiter U23 und U19
executives.notes: Key figure in youth development since 2021. Meets 2+ year minimum tenure. Developed players like Aaron Zehnter and Henri Koudossou.

executives.name: Heinz Moser

sources.title: Marinko Jurendic wird Sportdirektor beim FCA
Heinz Moser nicht mehr beim FC Augsburg
Bundesliga, Augsburg: Heinz Mosers stiller Abgang

clubs.notes: 55-year-old from Switzerland, previously at FC Zürich in same role. Contract was until June 30, 2026 but left quietly in 2024. Tenure too short for minimum criteria. Replaced by Manuel Baum.

executives.notes: Brief tenure (August 2023 - 2024), does not meet 2+ year minimum. 15 years experience with Swiss national youth teams. Included for completeness.

executives.name: Manuel Baum

sources.title: Augsburg interim coach Manuel Baum to stay in charge until end of 2025/26
Official | Manuel Baum to return as Augsburg interim head coach

clubs.notes: Started as Head of Development and Football Innovation July 1, 2025. Replaced Heinz Moser. Later became interim head coach December 2025. Previously FCA head coach 2016-2019. Tenure too short to meet minimum criteria.

executives.current_role: Head Coach (interim until end of 2025/26 season)
executives.notes: Recent appointment (July 2025), does not meet 2+ year minimum yet. Former FCA coach who developed Marco Richter, Raphael Framberger, Kevin Danso. Included for completeness.

executives.name: Alexander Frankenberger

sources.title: Personelle Veränderungen im NLZ für die Saison 2024/25
Alexander Frankenberger - Cheftrainer Nachwuchs

clubs.notes: Talent Manager and Coordinator for Player Development starting 2024/25 season. Previously U19 coach. Tenure too short for minimum criteria. Included for completeness.

executives.notes: Recent appointment (2024), does not meet 2+ year minimum yet. Included for completeness.

executives.name: Günter Hausmann

sources.title: FCA Nachwuchsleitungszentrum zertifiziert und Lizenziert

clubs.notes: Youth director with 52 years at FC Augsburg (previously BCA). Long-serving youth coach. Likely retired around 2011 based on interview timing. Covered part of 2010-2024 period.

executives.notes: Long-serving youth director who would have been in role during early part of target period (2010-2011). Limited detailed information available on exact end date.

executives.name: Roger Prinzen

clubs.role: Sportlicher Leiter Nachwuchsleistungszentrum / Academy Sports Director

sources.title: Roger Prinzen - Manager profile | Transfermarkt
Das HARTMANN NLZ | 1. FC Heidenheim 1846 e. V.

clubs.notes: Former player (born 1969) who transitioned to academy management. Appointed as Academy Manager on July 2, 2018, serving as Sportlicher Leiter (Sports Director) of the HARTMANN NachwuchsLeistungsZentrum. Still in position as of 2026.

executives.notes: Key figure in youth development for 1. FC Heidenheim since their NLZ was established. Would work with academy coaches throughout the system.

executives.name: Nils Weng

clubs.role: Organisatorischer Leiter Nachwuchsleistungszentrum / Academy Organizational Director

sources.title: Nils Weng - Manager profile | Transfermarkt
Nils Weng: Vom Dualen Studenten zum NLZ-Leiter – 10 Jahre FCH Mitarbeiter | 1. FC Heidenheim 1846 e. V.

clubs.notes: Joined FCH in 2014 as dual study student. After completing bachelor's degree, served as Coordinator of Talent Management (2017-01 to 2019-06), then promoted to Academy Manager role on July 1, 2019. Oversees organizational aspects of the HARTMANN NLZ.

clubs.role: Koordinator Talentmanagement / Coordinator of Talent Management

sources.title: Nils Weng - Manager profile | Transfermarkt

clubs.notes: Intermediate role before promotion to Academy Manager. Focused on talent identification and development coordination.

executives.notes: Internal promotion from within FCH system. Recognized for 10 years of service in February 2024. Key administrative contact for academy coaches and youth development initiatives.

executives.name: Robert Strauß

sources.title: Warum Sportdirektor Robert Strauß den 1. FC Heidenheim zum Saisonende verlässt - Heidenheimer Zeitung
2. Bundesliga: Ex-Profi Robert Strauß wird Bereichsleiter Sport beim 1. FC Heidenheim
Robert Strauß beendet seine Tätigkeit zum 30. Juni auf eigenen Wunsch hin | 1. FC Heidenheim 1846 e. V.

clubs.notes: Former professional player at FCH who transitioned to executive role. Responsible for sporting matters around the professional team and the youth performance center. Left on own request after 2 years in role for family reasons.

executives.notes: Former FCH player (2012-2020) who became Vorstandsassistent (board assistant) from 2020-2022 before promotion to Head of Sport. Over 12+ years with the club. Would have worked with coaches across first team and academy during tenure.
